definition: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, movie by Ang Lee 李安[Li3 An1]
lit. hidden dragon, crouching tiger (idiom)/fig. talented individuals in hiding/concealed talent
to lie/to crouch
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
storehouse/depository/Buddhist or Taoist scripture
Tibet/Xizang 西藏
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
dragon/CL:條|条[tiao2]/imperial
surname Long

sentences.english: Another testimony that in Jianghu, everyone has an evil heart, and everywhere there are crouching tigers and hidden dragons.
sentences.chinese: 再一次证实了江湖上人心险恶，处处卧虎藏龙。

sentences.english: The film "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon" is on at the cinema.
sentences.chinese: 电影院正在放《卧虎藏龙》这部电影。

sentences.english: Ang Lee’s Crouching Tiger had kind of done so.
sentences.chinese: 但是李安的《卧虎藏龙》在某些方面已经做到了。

sentences.english: You may not know but TTC is also a place where there are crouching tigers and hidden dragons.
sentences.chinese: 大家也许有所不知三一是一个卧虎藏龙的地方。

sentences.english: In Crouching Tiger, that motion has its own poetry.
sentences.chinese: 在《卧虎藏龙》中，这场打斗充满诗情画意。

sentences.english: The filem "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon" created a sensation in the world.
sentences.chinese: 《卧虎藏龙》这部电影在世界上引起轰动。

sentences.english: Folk art is really clearing up, Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon.
sentences.chinese: 民间艺术真是高手如云，卧虎藏龙。

definition: lit. hidden dragon, crouching tiger (idiom)/fig. talented individuals in hiding/concealed talent
Ambush from Ten Sides (pipa solo piece)/House of Flying Daggers (2004 movie by Zhang Yimou 張藝謀|张艺谋[Zhang1 Yi4 mou2])
Curse of the Golden Flower (2007), period drama movie by Zhang Yimou
pinyin: Man3 cheng2 jin4 dai4 huang2 jin1 jia3

definition: Ang Li (1954-), Taiwanese-American film director (films include Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon 臥虎藏龍|卧虎藏龙 and Brokeback Mountain 斷背山|断背山)
The Conqueror Bids Farewell to His Favorite Concubine (tragic opera by Mei Lanfang 梅蘭芳|梅兰芳[Mei2 Lan2 fang1])/Farewell My Concubine (1993 film by Chen Kaige)
Tsui Hark (1951-), Chinese movie director and producer
Jiang Wen (1963-), sixth generation Chinese movie director
moviedom/the world of movies/film circles
Wong Kar-wai (1956-), Hong Kong film director
Zhang Yimou (1950-), PRC film director
Golden Horse Film Festival and Awards
Academy Awards/Oscars/CL:屆|届[jie4]
pinyin: Ao4 si1 ka3 jin1 xiang4 jiang3

definition: moviedom/the world of movies/film circles
the prime of life
however strong you are, there is always someone stronger (idiom)/there is always sth more to learn/never be satisfied to rest on your laurels/there is no room for complacency
pinyin: qiang2 zhong1 zi4 you3 qiang2 zhong1 shou3

definition: Yip Man (1893-1972), martial arts practitioner, master of Bruce Lee
